post.author: Kiltron
post.body:
As a lot of you may know, I've been on a very long hiatus and it's mainly been because I'm trying to complete the Dark Salvation project I started years back. It's amazing how long creating a game takes when you start from scratch with no money and an on and off development team, but things have changed and progressed tremendously despite any setbacks we've had and all the obstacles we've run into. Much has been done to the point of near completion on this project and it is starting to feel good. It's never hard to start a project nor even work on a project for a certain amount of time but the hardest thing you can ever do in game development is complete and release a project. I do believe we have created something that is a solid FPS shooter that is fun to play. While it does use a bit of dated Quake 3 Arena engine technology, we've made the engine look as good as it can for what it is and we didn't aim at beefing up the graphics renderer itself. The fun factor was the main goal.

With that said we've released a teaser trailer in two flavors showing off some of the oil painted style of in game cinematics as well as some gameplay footage for some of the levels. Nothing too fancy, just a dark video to show what we've been up to for so long and a hint to what the game is about. So you can view the site and video normally but for kicks if you have a pair of Anaglyph 3D glasses handy, you can view the site and video in 3D. Just click the glasses in the bottom right hand corner.

WARNING: The video does contain some brutal gore & violence, so if you are easily offended or disgusted do not click. Viewer discretion is advised.

http://www.mangledeye.com/darksalvation/teaser.html

All feedback is welcome.

post.author: Kiltron
post.body:
Thanks for the feeback everyone. I'll try and answer what I can.

I really don't want to say the game plays like Quake or Painkiller since I don't want to really relate the games like that to one another, but you are correct in both aspects of the type of gameplay there is. You have open free exploration in some parts of levels while other parts have arena combat style of gameplay. It is definitely fast paced, probably just a tiny bit slower than Quake 3 Arena.

As far as the monsters just falling over and dying, they actually have both death animations and/or gibbed deaths.

Yes that is the main character. When you see her skeletal hands from the purple crystal she's carrying, that is the object she became possessed with when it approached her. When she touched it, it burnt off the flesh of her forearms while transferring it's power to her.

Definitely oldschool fps gaming is exactly what we've aimed for.

We are for sure working on putting together a more detailed video of just the gameplay which will be in the official trailer. This will be a much higher res video.

With the buffering issues on playing the video, yeah we've noticed it and I believe it had something to do with the hosting package we originally had. I've contacted the host to upgrade the package to something that will allow more bandwidth for uninterrupted video streaming.

I'm really looking forward to getting the pictures back of the real life model (shown in the upper right corner of the concept art) showing her in that outfit and releasing them to the public. I get a ****** just thinking about it!

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body:
I applaud what you're doing Kiltron. Dev time is so lengthy on beefier engines and there's the possibility of the team falling apart because of it, I have given thought myself many times to trying to do something artistically stylized in the q3 engine (or even the doomsday engine) for that very reason. There is a niche for it, look at all the people who still play CS for it's low requirements, you'll be reaching a larger audience than you would with something tech 4 and up.

I'm looking forward to playing it already, I get that itch for some old school type action and it's a really dry genre these days. I like the overall aspect of what I saw, the levels look like scary nightmarish places but with a little twist of dark insanity almost reminiscent of something along the lines of Alice. I was a little iffy about the main character when I saw the concept pic, but then I saw how cool and unique the in game hand models looked and I think she will work if done just right. Watching the video I was reminded of the game Painkiller somewhat, but that is'nt necessarily a bad thing, and the games art style looks unique enough that I don't think anyone would use the word "clone" unless they were the usual unreasonable fanboy haters of all id engine games(I'm sure you've been around the Doom boards and read enough reviews to know who I'm talking about). Now that I really think about it...That is probably what draws me to it is looks like my type of game(like the kind of games I like: Doom, Quake, Painkiller, etc.), except it's fresh and new with cool looking new weapons and an intriguing character, and what looks like might possibly be a good story. Already I found myself asking questions, I want to know more about what's going on, what went wrong, etc. and that's what a good story or basic game scenario should do is pull you in and keep you gripped like that.

It looks like you're headed in the right direction. We don't know eachother personally in real life, but we've been what I'd call pleasant acquaintances at the least on these boards for quite a number of years now, I feel happy for you right now and I'm proud Kiltron. I'll be watching and I'm looking forward to completion and finally playing it.
